pkgmetadata.longdescription: The Knockoff Filter for Controlled Variable Selection // The knockoff filter is a general procedure for controlling the false discovery rate (FDR) when performing variable selection. For more information, see the website below and the accompanying paper: Candes et al., "Panning for gold: model-X knockoffs for high-dimensional controlled variable selection", J. R. Statist. Soc. B (2018) 80, 3, pp. 551-577.
